data.message: You need to make available actual, live customer service people that we can talk to, chat with, etc., to resolve issues.  An ad I tried to run recently was not approved, and I have no idea why.  I was never given a specific reason, only referred to the policy.  The ad had zero profanity, zero referring to the viewer's attributes, and zero harassment.  I tried appealing and explained all that, and after review the ad was actually approved, for 15 minutes, when I then received another email stating it was not approved.  The only thing I can guess is that the decision was discriminatory in nature since my post was faith-based. Glitch?

replies.message: Hi Dorci. Learn more about our Ad Policies and what steps to take if your ad has been denied here: http://bit.ly/2v6SDMs. Hope this helps! -Ashley

No, I'm sorry, it doesn't. I've read the policy three times, I've appealed twice, I've left a review stating I was not satisfied because there was nothing in the ad whatsoever that violated the policy, and I still have yet to hear an exact reason for the ad denial, most likely because there is none. I'd like to speak to someone, not just be constantly referred to the policy.
